p: Lavandula angustifolia Mill. from the Lamiaceae family consists of essential oil that can inhibit isoproterenol-induced myocardial infarction in rats ( Ezzoubi et al., 2014). It protected the myocardium against isoproterenol-induced myocardial infarction at the concentration of 20 mg/kg of the essential oil. This amount of oil had caused the reduction in the ST-elevation of the myocardial infarction situation, resembled its effectiveness in cardiovascular disease, and indicated its protective effects on cell membrane functions ( Ezzoubi et al., 2014).
